शिक्षा योग्यता व्यवस्था स्थापित करने की बात कही गई है । मेरा यह मानना है कि इस व्यवस्था से आने वाले वर्षों में देश के युवाओं को कुशल एवं योग्य बनने के लिए बेहतरीन अवसर मिलेंगे । उचित उत्पादन के साथ - साथ उसके व्यवस्थित वितरण की व्यवस्था होना भी अति आवश्यक है । हमारी सरकार का यह प्रयास होना चाहिए कि किसान को उसके उत्पादन का उचित मूल्य मिले , उसके उत्पाद का उचित भंडारण हो सके । उन कारणों को समाप्त किया जाए जिनसे पैदा किए हुए अनाज की आवश्यक बर्बादी होती है । यह अति चिंता का विषय है कि एक तरफ एकत्रित अनाज सड़ता है तथा जिनको उसकी आवश्यकता है उनके पास पहुंच नहीं पाता । देश की आंतरिक सुरक्षा तथा आतंकवाद पर समय - समय पर सदन में चर्चा हो चुकी है और उस चर्चा के अधार पर केन्द्रीय तथा राजकीय सरकार जो कदम उठा रही है उनमें एक समन्वय होकर तत्वों को समाप्त करने की क्षमता आनी चाहिए । इसके लिए एक समन्वित नीति की तथा उसके संपादन की अवश्यकता है । यदि किसी विषय को लागू करने से पूर्व चर्चा की आवश्यकता है तो उसमें संकोच नहीं किया जाना चाहिए । यह सुनिश्चित करना अति आवश्यक है कि हमारी सरकारें देशवासियों को एक भयमुक्त जीवन जीने के लिए अनुकूल वातावरण देने के लिए हमारी सरकार तत्पर है । मैं किसान परिवार से हूं और किसानों की आय दुगनी करने के लिए सरकार बहुत प्रयास कर रही है । युवाओं को खेती के लिए प्रशिक्षण संचालन तथा अपने - अपने क्षेत्र में विलक्षणता प्राप्त हो सके इसका पक्षधर हूं । मैं चाहता हूं कि हर युवा को खेती का प्रशिक्षण मिले । सुख सुविधाएं मिलें तथा न केवल वह राष्ट्रीय स्तर पर बल्कि वह अतर्राष्ट्रीय स्तर पर अपने उत्पादन का प्रदर्शन करे । नागरिकता संशोधन कानून पर चल रहे राजनीतिक मतभेद खत्म करने हेतु सरकार हर संभव प्रयासरत है । स्वास्थ्य , शिक्षा , खाद्यान्न , आवास जैसी बुनियादी आवश्यकताओं पर विस्तारपूर्वक प्रकाश डाला गया है । इसके साथ ही , मैं महामहिम राष्ट्रपति जी के इस अभिभाषण का पूरी तरह से समर्थन करता हूं । धन्यवाद । * * SHRI H. VASANTHAKUMAR (KANYAKUMARI): I would like to place my views on motion of thanks on the address delivered by His Excellency President of India. The Address speaks about what has been done and what will be done in the next year. I am sorry to say that I am very much disappointed to find that there is no road map for development. In the last 5 years millions of jobs have been lost and crores of our youth have been rendered jobless. Besides, the policy of the government is such that small and medium enterprises cannot carry on their business smoothly. Lakhs of enterprises have been closed. Unless demand is created there will be no progress in economy. The Budget also, directionless, focus less will add to the problem. The whole country is being divided on religious lines by the Government. This government is against even silent protest which is a democratic right of every citizen. I demand to know why Muslims have been excluded. The whole world is against government decision. Even the European Parliament deeply regretted the adoption of CAA and called on the Indian Government to reconsider the CAA. Misuse of the NPR by the Government in conjunction with the NRC, the government is offering non-Muslims the opportunity to register as citizens of India, and if left out of the NRC, they can apply for citizenship under the provisions of the new CAA. Why has the government created this multiplicity of conflicting laws? The decision is against humanity and all norms of principles of natural justice. How many persons other than Muslims have been given citizenship? I demand a white paper on the issue. The Supreme Court in a judgment pertaining to the communication blockade in Jammu and Kashmir, stated that using the internet to exercise freedom of speech and to practice any profession or business is a fundamental right. The communication blockade has affected the economy, physical and mental health of the people of Jammu and Kashmir. Crimes against women are increasing every day. After Nirbhaya incident, though the Law was amended and strengthened, yet there has been no decrease in the number of cases of rape and sexual assault. The short-sighted and divisive policies being implemented by PM Modi's government, and the resulting political and social instability are serving as a setback to the Indian economy. My constituency Kanyakumari is an internationally famous tourist destination, frequented by lakhs of tourists, both from India and abroad. But the railway facilities are inadequate, and due to this, many tourists avoid coming to Kanyakumari. The tourist traffic in Kanyakumari generates a huge revenue for the government. We want an Airport also. There is no announcement about introduction of new trains in Kanyakumari region and long pending public demand for construction of RUB and ROB in Kanyakumari constituency, namely, Kappiyarai, Kuzhithurai, Eraniel, Virikoddu, Marthandam, Agastheeswaram. Kanyakumari is the only district in Tamil Nadu where rubber is produced and roughly 24,020 tonnes of rubber is produced annually. The geographical location of Kanyakumari helps it to excel in rubber industry. A few years ago, Rubber Board at Kottayam in Kerala formulated a project to set up a rubber Park in Kanyakumari and it sent its proposal also. But, nothing came out of it. The Minimum Support Price given for rubber is very, very less and it should be increased to Rs. 200 to Rs.250/- per kg. for natural rubber. The government has not addressed linking of rivers especially of Tamilnadu. There are certain Inter-State Water issues between Tamil Nadu and Kerala, Tamil Nadu and Karnataka and Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh. It is a very interesting fact that all the states are Dravidian States and have close knit relationships, especially even in marriages. When a state refuses water to another state within the Dravidian state, it means that the state is refusing water to their own children and Relatives. The government is very well aware that farmers take loans from banks for agricultural pruposes, and even for personal commitments, like, children's education, medical expenses, marriages etc. Farmers are not able to grow any crops and they are not able to repay the loans taken from banks and other. I request you to kindly look into the matter personally and do justice to the Part Time Casual Labourers, Who have been working in the Postal department for the last so many years and if suddenly they are thrown out of their jobs, they would be facing severe hardship. As you know my constituency Kanyakumari is a coastal area where the three oceans meet. A considerable percentage of population are engaged in fishing. When the fishermen go for fishing, they sometimes lose their way and get lost in the middle of the ocean or get stuck up due to natural calamities like storms, high tides etc. Many lives have been lost due to lack of proper action or coordination to rescue them. The government should announce a compensation of Rs. 10 lakh in case the person is missing for more than one year and provide a death certificate also. At present, there is no Coast Guard Station in Kanyakumari to rescue the fishermen. Kanyakumari, which is located at the southernmost part of India is a small district. The total area of the district is 1700 square kilometers, but the total forest cover of the district is nearly 500 square kilometers. It is learnt that there is a proposal to increase the forest cover. We demand to the Zero point for Economic sensitive Zone in Kanyakumari area. The district is backward industrial wise, and moreover, rubber is produced in plenty. If the forest cover is increased, there will be very less land available for industrialization. Main occupation of the people of the district is fishing. As it may be aware fishing is a very risky job. Every year hundreds of fishermen are killed during fishing activities. Thousands of youth remain unemployed due to lack of industries. If the proposal is implemented, more than 80 villages and large number of rubber gardens, Kothiyar Hydro power generation plant will be affected and more than 69 villages located in Western Ghats and 18 Panchayat Unions will also be affected. It is not understood why all these factors were not taken into account while formulating the proposal. I, therefore, request the government to immediately withdraw this proposal of development of land around Kanyakumari Sanctuary cum Eco Sensitive Zone. The Government to ban Online Business immediately, to safeguard the interest of 4.5 crore small traders and shopkeepers, who are on the verge of closure because of Online business. The coconut root-wilt disease has sounded an alarm in the state and elsewhere. I urge upon the Union Government to take remedial measures on a war footing and direct the concerned officials and scientists to combat the disease, and compensation be given to the affected farmers immediately. What about income tax? The Hon'ble Finance Minister knows only when enough money is in circulation, economy would get a boost. Recently, BUDGET raised the surcharge on individuals was increased from 15% to 37% and also the substantial increase in maximum rate of gross tax is 42.74% from 35.88%. It unveils that the Government imposed an additional surcharge on India's top earners may net the government a paltry sum, but damage investor confidence, force the wealthy to find loopholes. In the present system of income-tax there is no security available for the genuine tax payers. If a person insured substantial business loss after paying several decades do not get any support from the government, only the losses are recognised and allowed to be adjusted against future profits. Hence, I urge upon the Union Government to consider some monetary support to the genuine tax payers, who are incurring legitimate business loss at the time of distress to re-establish their business. The pinch will be largely felt by the salaried and professionals, about income tax rates? Why they have not been decreased? If the government decreases the personal income tax people would have more money in their hands and the consumption would increase and the economy would be revived. But the government is clueless about reviving the economy. The government is talking ad hoc measures, but they have not taken any concrete steps. I urge upon the Hon'ble Minister the GST rates may be revised from 28% to 18% on some items and 18% to 12%, and 12% to 5% on other items and also the GST charged on rent from restaurants, which is 18%, may be reduced to 5%. The rate of 5% GST charged on packed food items, such as, rice, foodgrains, etc., may be waived off. I urge upon the Government to ban the online games, such as, Blue Whale and PUBG, (PLAYER UNKNOWN BATTLE GROUND), RUMMY. Many parents complain that computer games have no value to their children's study. On the contrary, those online games have produced a lot of negative effects on their mental and physical development. I urge upon the Government only a national ban will give a possible result. Traditional games remind kids today what they are missing. There is a long pending demand to convert the existing Government General Hospital in Nagercoil, which caters to the entire Kanyakumari district, into a Super Speciality Hospital. The present hospital does not have modern equipments, modern health facilities and enough beds to cater to the entire population of the district. The people of this district have to go to other districts, especially as far as to Thiruvanthapuram for getting treatment. Under thePradhan MantriSwasthya Suraksha Yojna Scheme, certain selected hospitals were taken up and converted into Super Speciality Hospitals. Therefore, I request that the hospital in Nagercoil should also be upgraded and converted into a Super Speciality Hospital. A 7-storeyed building estimate is Rs. 170 crore, two oxidation ponds worth 8 crores for waste disposal and one casualty block, estimate of Rs. 1.5 crore, to be built. The above proposal has already been sent by the State Government to Central Health Department. The above proposal for establishement of Super Speciality Hospital in Kanyakumari and also its inclusion in Phase 5 upgradation under PMSSY scheme is pending for the three years. There is no information and scheme for employment generation.

Speaker: SHRI D.K. SURESH (BANGALORE RURAL)
Speech: I would like to express my views on motion of thanks to the President's Address. It is very unfortunate that the President of India's address to both the Houses of Parliament has become a platform to legitimise the government's mistakes. The Union Government had included the CAA in President Ram Nath Kovind's speech as an achievement of the government despite massive protests against the bill. The Government has lowered the dignity of the President's office as the validity of the CAA has been challenged in the Supreme Court. The speech did not have any concrete steps on tackling real issues like unemployment, rise in prices of essential commodities, fall in the value of the rupee, or the GDP. When we have questioned the Constitutional morality of some of the steps taken by the Government, which we have said are discriminatory and divisive, they should not have found any reference in the President's address. There is not a single word on the macro-economic situation of the country. No mention on lost jobs, increasing unemployment and rising consumer price inflation. Not a word on the closure of thousands of industries, especially in the small and medium-sized enterprises sector. The President mentioned A new India, in which adequate facilities and new opportunities for growth are available for the poor, dalits, women, youth, tribals and minorities. The statement is far from reality. The crime against Dalits are increasing and there are several mob lynching instances reported against Dalits and the conviction rate for violent crimes against Dalits is only 23.8%. According to Census 2011 data, only 102 sub-districts out of 564 have Eklavya Model Residential Schools. The Government still needs to open 462 new schools. Yet, only 145 residential schools and 5 day boarding schools have been sanctioned during 2018-19 and 2019-20. In the Address to both houses of the Parliament, Hon'ble President mentioned that Under PM Kisan Samman Nidhi, in 8 crore accounts, Rs 43,000 crore have been deposited however an RTI report has revealed that almost 75% of farmers have not received all three instalments due to them in the first year of the PM Kisan Scheme. In order to receive the fourth instalment of the scheme, bank accounts will have to be mandatorily linked to Aadhaar. Approximately 13 million farmers in UP alone will be affected by this. Modi Sarkar has failed abysmally on all three key targets of its Make in India scheme. Its first target was to increase the manufacturing sector's growth rate to 12-14% per annum, but the sector has only grown, on an average, at half of the targeted growth rate. In Financial Year 2020, the manufacturing sector growth plummeted to paltry 2 percent. The second goal of increasing share of manufacturing in GDP to 25 percent by 2020 has also not been met since this figure has remained only around 15 percent. The government is also clearly unable to meet its third target of creating 100 million additional jobs by 2022 in manufacturing sector, given its refusal to provide numbers on how many jobs were actually created as a result of the scheme and the devastating figures provided by the NSSO estimating the unemployment rate in 2017-18 at a 45-year high of 6.1 percent. FDI in manufacturing, which has been an important aim of the government is only 28% of total FDI, and far below the average level of 44% achieved during UPA-II. The President says, government is determined to reach the goal of a $5 trillion economy, and is taking steps towards this. However, today India has the worst economy in 42 years. For six quarters, the GDP growth rate has been falling. If India is to be a $5 trillion economy by 2024, the economy needs to grow at 12 percent. Nominal growth dropped to 6.1 percent in second quarter of financial year 2019-20. The Address also failed to mention drop of India's rank on the Global Press Freedom Index, EIU's Global Democracy Index and a low rank on the Global Hunger Index. The Government is silent over the six-month long detention of political leaders, including the sitting MP from Jammu and Kashmir and former Chief Ministers of the state of Kashmir.

Speaker: श्री राजेश नारणभाई चुड़ासमा ( जूनागढ़ )
Speech: महामहिम राष्ट्रपति जी के द्वारा संसद में दिए गए अभिभाषण पर अपने विचार व्यक्त करना चाहता हूं । आज हम अत्यंत महत्वपूर्ण विषय पर चर्चा कर रहे हैं । कुछ सप्ताह पहले 26 नवंबर को संविधान के 70 वर्ष पूरे हुए और भारत के सपनों को पूरा करने में हमारा मार्गदर्शक भारत का संविधान है । हमारा संविधान देश के प्रति अपनी ज़िम्मेदारी , रक्षा और कर्त्तव्यों को बोध करता है । माननीय राष्ट्रपति का अभिभाषण देश की आशा और आकांक्षाओं और उस दिशा में उठाए गए कदमों की अभिव्यक्ति था । अपने भाषण के माध्यम से माननीय राष्ट्रपति जी ने विश्व के सबसे बड़े लोकतंत्र में 17 वीं लोक सभा के बजट सत्र में जिस तरह से निर्णायक और महत्वपूर्ण विषयों का निष्पादन किया वह बिल्कुल काबिले तारीफ हैं क्योंकि इस तरह से कार्यों के निष्पादन पिछले सत्तर दशकों में देखने को नहीं मिला यह अपने आप में एक रिकार्ड के रूप में है । जैसा कि माननीय राष्ट्रपति जी के भाषण द्वारा उल्लेख किया गया कि इस 17 वीं लोक सभा में सरकार की दृढ़ इच्छाशक्ति के कारण मुस्लिम महिलाओं को न्याय और अधिकार देने वाला तीन तलाक विरोधी कानून , देशवासियों को नए अधिकार देने वाला उपभोक्ता संरक्षण कानून , गरीबों की बचत की रक्षा करने वाला अनियमित जमा योजना प्रतिबंध कानून , गरीबों को चिटफंड स्कीमों के धोखे से बचाने वाला चिटफंड संशोधन कानून , बच्चों के खिलाफ यौन अपराधों की सज़ा सख्त करने वाला कानून , सड़क हादसों में कमी लाने के लिए मोटर वाहन संशोधन कानून और ट्रांसजेंडर व्यक्तियों के अधिकारों को संरक्षण देने वाला कानून , जैसे अनेक ऐतिहासिक कानून बनाए और कठोर निर्णय लिए गए । हालांकि मैं बताना चाहूंगा कि बीते पांच वर्षों के दौरान देशवासियों में जो विश्वास जगा है कि सरकार हमेशा उनके साथ और उनका जीवन बेहतर बनाने और उन्हें आगे बढ़ाने के लिए काम कर रही है । देशवासियों के विश्वास की इस पूंजी के आधार पर एक बार फिर हमारी सरकार भारत के लोगों का उनका दिल जीतने में कामयाब रही है । माननीय राष्ट्रपति जी के अभिभाषण में एक ऐसा नया भारत बन रहा है , जिसमें हमारी पुरातन संस्कृति का गौरव हो और जो 21 वीं सदी के विश्व को अपने ज्ञान की शक्ति से समृद्ध करे । एक ऐसा नया भारत बन रहा है , जिसमें पुरानी समस्याओं के समाधान के साथ ही विकास के नए अध्याय लिखे जाएंगे । एक ऐसा नया भारत बन रहा है , जिसमें गरीबों , दलितों , महिलाओं , युवाओं , अदिवासियों और अल्पसंख्यकों को पर्याप्त सुविधा मिले और आगे बढ़ने के नए अवसर भी । हमारा देश एक ऐसा नया भारत बन रहा है , जिससे हर क्षेत्र विकास करे , कोई भी पिछड़ा न रह जाए , जहां आधुनिक टेक्नोलॉजी का लाभ समाज के आखिरी छोर तक पहुंचे । एक ऐसा नया भारत जो चौथी औद्योगिक क्रांति में अग्रणी भूमिका निभाए और विश्व मंच में नई ऊंचाइयों पर पहुंच रहा है । हमारी सरकार ने सिर्फ नई योजनाओं की घोषणा करने और अखबार की सुर्खियां बटोरने और जनता को ठगने में विश्वास नहीं रखती है जैसे कि विपक्षी पार्टियां सत्ता में आने के बाद लोगों के साथ करती हैं और कर रही हैं । हमारी सरकार जो कहती है वह करके भी दिखाती है और साथ ही सभी गरीब , पिछड़ों , महिलाओं , दलितों और युवाओं को आगे बढ़ाने के लिए सदैव तत्पर रहती है और उनके उम्मीदों को कभी तोड़ने नहीं देती है । यही है भारतीय जनता पार्टी की असली छवि और हमें गर्व है कि जिस तरह से भाजपा की सरकार ने देश के लिए एक से एक निर्णायक कदम उठा रही उसकी जितनी भी तारीफ की जाए वो कम है । मैं बताना चाहूंगा कि हमारी सरकार का मंत्र सबका साथ सबका विकास और सबका विश्वास के मंत्र पर जिस तरह से कार्य कर रही है उससे भारत के विकास के लिए अभूतपूर्व है और हमने यह करके दिखाया है , इसलिए हमने भारत के लोगों का दिल के साथ उनका विश्वास भी जीता है । भारत के अंतरिक्ष कार्यक्रम का लक्ष्य , सदैव मानवता की सेवा रहा है । देश के अतरिक्ष वैज्ञानिकों के अथक परिश्रम के कारण चन्द्रयान -2 ने देश के युवाओं में टेक्नोलॉजी के प्रति नई ऊर्जा का संचार किया है । मैं महामहिम राष्ट्रपति जी का शुक्रिया अदा करना चाहूंगा कि चन्द्रयान -3 को सफल बनाने के लिए स्वीकृति दी और इसरो द्वारा मानव अंतरिक्ष यान कार्यक्रम - गगनयान तथा आदित्य - एक मिशन पर भी तेजी से कार्य हो रहा है । जिस तरह से हमारी सरकार देश को आगे बढ़ाने के लिए तेजी से कार्य कर रही है और देश को मजबूत बनाने के लिए महत्वपूर्ण और निर्णायक कदम उठा रही है उसके बारे में कहने को तो बहुत कुछ है और मैं जितना भी कहूं वो कम पड़ जाएगा । इस विचार के साथ मैं प्रस्ताव करता हूं कि हम लोक सभा के सदस्य 31 जनवरी , 2020 को एकत्र हुए दोनों सदनों की संयुक्त बैठक में दिए गए अभिभाषण के लिए महामहिम राष्ट्रपति जी के प्रति आभार प्रकट करता हूं । बहुत - बहुत धन्यवाद ।
